page.title: 19EVENTS IN FORDYCE
page.content: Annual events begin with a Scotch Nicht held around January 26th to mark Robert Burns' birthday. A supper of haggis,neeps(turnips) & Tatties(pota- toes)is prepared & an evening of Burns songs & poems follows. In Springtime there is a Daffodil Tea,a fund-raising event held on a fine Saturday after- noon by one of the local groups. The highlight of the year is Fordyce Gala,when 8 associations make a joint effort to organise sponsors,raffles, stalls e.g.Tombola,Wheel of Fortune, Bric-a-Brac,etc.,side-shows like Dart throwing,Golf,the "stocks",Pony Rides, Highland Dancing,Sheepdog Trials,Dips and teas,etc. A Ploughing Match is held in Autumn,Harvest Thanksgiving & Hallowe'en in Oct,Bonfires on Nov.5th, Carol Services at Christmas and great celebrations at Hogmanay (3lst Dec.)
